caption:
This photograph captures a man standing on a large tree stump in a cleared forest area, conveying a sense of environmental destruction or logging. The man, wearing casual attire with a light-colored shirt and pants, gazes into the distance, appearing contemplative or concerned. His shadow is cast sharply on the stump, indicating bright and direct sunlight.

The background shows a stark landscape primarily devoid of foliage, with just a few tall trees standing in the distance against a clear sky. The ground around the man is littered with debris from felled trees, including branches and wood chips, highlighting the aftermath of tree-clearing activities. The overall mood set by the composition feels somber and reflective, emphasizing the impact of human activity on natural forests.
title: Indiscriminate logging has desTroyed timber on slopes of the Redwood Creek watershed, causing silting and erosion damage.
